page.title: 17Moyn's Park, Birdbrook,cont.
page.content: fine pieces of antique furniture including a beautiful Bechstein Grand piano, with two green matching lacquer chests.In the{Drawing Room}there is some furniture from the 18th century. There is a{secret bookcase}into the oldest wing dating from the 15th century. The oldest room in house has a full sized{modern billiards {table.}The beams are all hand carved. One of the bedrooms is called the{ {swallow room}because in the summer someone left the window open and a swallow made its nest in there. There are also stables and a{stud farm,}but when we visited there were only 20 foals and horses. When the moat was drained an old{gauntlet}was found from a suit of armour. Moyn's Park is not open to the public; the gardens are open occasionally under the National Gardens Scheme.
